title: Medical cannabis or cannabinoids for chronic non-cancer pain
subtitle: Systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials
summary: Moderate to high certainty evidence shows that non-inhaled medical cannabis or cannabinoids produce a small to very small improvement in pain relief, physical functioning and sleep quality in patients with chronic pain, with several transient side effects compared with placebo. The review includes RCTs with oral cannabinoids and evaluates benefit vs harms.

title: Medical cannabis and cannabinoids for impaired sleep
subtitle: Systematic review and meta-analysis
summary: This systematic review explored randomized clinical trials of medical cannabis or cannabinoids for impaired sleep. It highlights mixed results and methodological limitations, but suggests potential positive effects on some sleep parameters.

title: Cannabinoids for Anxiety and Sleep Disturbances: A Scoping Review
subtitle: Cannabinoids effects on anxiety symptoms and sleep
summary: Cannabinoids, particularly CBD, showed potential efficacy in improving anxiety symptoms and sleep disturbances. However, heterogeneity in study design and cannabinoid dosing limits generalizability.

title: Cannabinoid treatments for anxiety: A systematic review
subtitle: Anxiolytic and sedative effects of CBD
summary: Systematic review of CBD effects on anxiety and disrupted sleep, finding some anxiolytic effects of CBD in certain populations but inconsistent sleep outcomes.

title: Cannabis for Chronic Pain: Mechanistic Insights and Clinical Evidence
subtitle: Review of cannabis clinical evidence for neuropathy and arthritis pain
summary: Clinical evidence shows cannabinoids can significantly reduce chronic pain intensity, particularly neuropathic pain, and highlights mechanisms through the endocannabinoid system. It discusses dose, safety, and therapeutic contexts.

title: Therapeutic use of cannabis and cannabinoids: benefits and risks
subtitle: Current evidence summary for multiple conditions
summary: A narrative synthesis of current evidence for cannabis and cannabinoids in chronic pain, insomnia, psychiatric and neurologic disorders. It highlights both potential benefits and recognized risks such as addiction, cognitive impairment, and psychosis in vulnerable groups.
